<WebDataSource> Protocol Reference

DataSource protocal for custom datasources connectors. More...

#import <WebDataSource.h>

List of all members.

Public Member Functions

(id< WebDataSource >) - initWithOptions:
 The defualt initializer for data sources. The options dictionary contains the application data source options as define by its "DataSources.plist" configuration.
(BOOL) - createObject:
 Returns boolean indicating success of created object Typically the properties are a kvo compatible object that could be a NSDictionary, or simply an actual model object that has properties.
(BOOL) - updateObject:
 Updates a given object and returns sucess as boolean.
(BOOL) - deleteObject:
 Deletes a given object using the given identifier (ie primary key).
(id) - getObjectOfModel:withIdentifier:
 Returns a single propertiesable object with the given identifier (Must be autoreleased).
(id) - get:forObjectModel:withConditions:
 Returns a object/array/nil based on the params.
(void) - beginTransaction:
(id) - endTransaction:
 Ends a transaction, returning any results optional to the datasource, or nil if not supported.
(NSArray *) - getObjectsOfModel:withDataSourceQuery:
 This is an optional method that datasources can implement to retrun data with a specialized query specific to itself. IE for MysqlDataSource this is a pure SELECT*... query.

Detailed Description

DataSource protocal for custom datasources connectors.

Member Function Documentation

- (BOOL) createObject: (WebModelBase *)  object  

Returns boolean indicating success of created object Typically the properties are a kvo compatible object that could be a NSDictionary, or simply an actual model object that has properties.

The WebModelBase implements -allKeys that enables the implementing datasource to iterate through all persistable keys

  • (NSArray*)allKeys that returns all persistable keys this allows implementing classes to lookup the key/value combinations

Persistable key's values should be gaurinteed to be NSNumber, NSString, NSData..

- (id) get: (ResultType)  firstOrAll
forObjectModel: (Class)  aModelClass
withConditions: (NSDictionary *)  conditions 

Returns a object/array/nil based on the params.

Parameters:
firstOrAll Could be one of count, (NSNumber), first, last, all, page
conditions Should be a condition lookup, see example { "keyName":"value", "keyName":NSDictionary { "condition":"like | > | >= | between", "value":"aValue", "value2":"aValue" }

This could be complex compound lookups. { "OR | AND": NSArray {... } }

if conditions is nil, this method should return all, or first..

- (NSArray*) getObjectsOfModel: (Class)  aModelClass
withDataSourceQuery: (NSString *)  dataSourceSpecificData 
[optional]

This is an optional method that datasources can implement to retrun data with a specialized query specific to itself. IE for MysqlDataSource this is a pure SELECT*... query.

See each datasource's implementation details for the details of this query

- (id <WebDataSource>) initWithOptions: (NSDictionary *)  theOptions  

The defualt initializer for data sources. The options dictionary contains the application data source options as define by its "DataSources.plist" configuration.

for example se defualy DataSource.plist for example webApp DataSources.plist
